channel.title: Get your music quick and free!
channel.description:
I originally found this on YouTube, I've been using the method for quite some time now it works pretty good.
First of all, open [url=http://www.google.com]Google[/url].
In the search bar, put [u][i][b]intitle:"index.of" (mp3|mp4|avi) [/b][/i][/u]
After that put the band or song name. If it has spaces, use periods instead.
Lets say I'm looking for Three Days Grace, I'd put the following [u][i][b]intitle:"index.of" (mp3|mp4|avi) three.days.grace[/b][/i][/u]
Finally we need to take away the stuff we know we don't need. This will limit the searches to music only. To do this, we're going to add [u][i][b]-html -htm -css -php[/b][/i][/u]
In full it would look like [u][i][b]intitle:"index.of" (mp3|mp4|avi) three.days.grace -html -htm -css -php[/b][/i][/u]
Obviously change the three.days.grace to anything you'd like. You'll usually find whole albums (you can also just search an album name). What I like about this is that it seems like a rather fast download, you can preview it in your browser, and you don't have to bother opening another program such as LimeWire or uTorrent.

item.title: Get your music quick and free!
item.dc:creator: @lordslayer565 lordslayer565
item.description:
@lordslayer565 wrote:

[quote=“llib, post:9, topic:134343”]Wow :eek: I never took this program seriously until a few minutes ago…its actually pretty powerful lol.

Also I like on how the link ^ they state “Please do not use this program for illegal uses.” Yet it has torrent searching, music searching, serial key searching, password searching… o.O oops? lol[/quote]
It is legal to get/use a cd key/torrent if you already own the product and lose you’re key or disc. But yeah i know what you mean.

Read full topic

Here it is:

GitHub

octalmage/googlehacks

A compact utility for several Google hacks. Contribute to octalmage/googlehacks development by creating an account on GitHub.


^^ I found it ironic how google actually made it lol

item.dc:creator: @LegendaryLoser .Flair
item.description:
@LegendaryLoser wrote:

I originally found this on YouTube, I’ve been using the method for quite some time now it works pretty good.

First of all, open Google.

In the search bar, put intitle:“index.of” (mp3|mp4|avi)

After that put the band or song name. If it has spaces, use periods instead.

Lets say I’m looking for Three Days Grace, I’d put the following intitle:“index.of” (mp3|mp4|avi) three.days.grace

Finally we need to take away the stuff we know we don’t need. This will limit the searches to music only. To do this, we’re going to add -html -htm -css -php

In full it would look like intitle:“index.of” (mp3|mp4|avi) three.days.grace -html -htm -css -php

Obviously change the three.days.grace to anything you’d like. You’ll usually find whole albums (you can also just search an album name). What I like about this is that it seems like a rather fast download, you can preview it in your browser, and you don’t have to bother opening another program such as LimeWire or uTorrent.
